meanings.definition: State or assert that something is the case without providing evidence or proof.
meanings.sent1: She keeps claiming the sky is purple, but no one believes her.
meanings.sent2: He is always claiming he can run faster than anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The cat is claiming ownership of the entire house, including the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The toddler is claiming to be the king of the playground.
meanings.sent5: The politician is claiming to have a solution for every problem.

meanings.definition: Demand or assert one's right to something.
meanings.sent1: The workers are claiming better pay for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: She is claiming her seat back after getting up for a moment.
meanings.sent3: The dog is claiming his right to the last piece of bacon.
meanings.sent4: The student is claiming the top spot in the class with his grades.
meanings.sent5: The athlete is claiming victory in the race.

meanings.definition: To assert ownership or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The explorer is claiming the newly discovered island for his country.
meanings.sent2: The artist is claiming all the paintings in the gallery as her own.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel is claiming every nut in the park as its personal stash.
meanings.sent4: The pirate is claiming the treasure chest as his long-lost loot.
meanings.sent5: The farmer is claiming the entire field as his property.
